channel.title: [PI] follow/trade
channel.description:
How do I change the order of these?
this is how it is atm.
Walk here Trade with Follow
But I want it to be like in RS which is:
Walk here Follow Trade with.
How do i fix this?

item.title: [PI] follow/trade
item.dc:creator: @Coolrick Coolrick
item.description:
@Coolrick wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:356479”]It’s in PlayerAssistan. (src/server/model/players/PlayerAssistant)

public void showOption(int i, int l, String s, int a) { synchronized(c) { if(c.getOutStream() != null && c != null) { if(!optionType.equalsIgnoreCase(s)) { optionType = s; c.getOutStream().createFrameVarSize(104); c.getOutStream().writeByteC(i); c.getOutStream().writeByteA(l); c.getOutStream().writeString(s); c.getOutStream().endFrameVarSize(); c.flushOutStream(); } } } } [/quote] I found that but how do I get it so it would show up as: Walk here, follow, trade with?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] follow/trade
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Simple as this:

getPA().showOption(4, 0,"Follow", 4); getPA().showOption(5, 0,"Trade with", 3);

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] follow/trade
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“v0x, post:3, topic:356471”]In Client.java

outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();

outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(4); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Follow"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();

outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(5); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Trade with"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();
Thats the order mine is in.

outStream.writeByteC(#);
This is the command slot, so it would be
Attack
Follow
Trade With

Because we have them in order that way.

Basically you could just search follow untill you find something similar to the code i posted (if not exactly the same) and change the order so it matches what you please

P.S

TRADE and FOLLOW were found under

	public void initialize() {

and ATTACK was found uner

public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {

^ This

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] follow/trade
item.dc:creator: @v0x v0x
item.description:
@v0x wrote:

In Client.java

outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(3); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Attack"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();

outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(4); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Follow"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();

outStream.createFrameVarSize(104); outStream.writeByteC(5); outStream.writeByteA(0); outStream.writeString("Trade with"); outStream.endFrameVarSize();
Thats the order mine is in.

outStream.writeByteC(#);
This is the command slot, so it would be
Attack
Follow
Trade With

Because we have them in order that way.

Basically you could just search follow untill you find something similar to the code i posted (if not exactly the same) and change the order so it matches what you please

P.S

TRADE and FOLLOW were found under

	public void initialize() {

and ATTACK was found uner

public boolean isInWilderness(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
